author: Kelly Terez
title: Miami Fires Head Football Coach Al Golden
text:
Share Article 
Joel Auerbach/Getty Images (MIAMI) -- Miami's head football coach is out. 
On Sunday, Miami University Athletic Director Blake James said the university had fired Hurricanes head football coach Al Golden. 
"Coach Golden has led our program through some very difficult times and he has done so with class, integrity and a true desire to see our students succeed on the field, in the classroom and in the community," said James in a release, according to ESPN . "However, we have a proud tradition of excellence at Miami, not just in football but in all sports, and we want to compete for ACC and national championships. I simply believe that now is the time to bring the Hurricane Family together and rally behind our young men." 
The news comes a day after the school's biggest loss of all time, 58-0 against Clemson. 
Fans this season have been calling for Golden's dismissal. Planes were hired to fly banners over games telling the university to fire the coach. 
Former Hurricanes players, including defensive tackle Warren Sapp, regularly spoke out about their disapproval with the coach. 
Another Hurricane player, former running back Clinton Portis, tweeted his disapproval with the decision, however, saying, "thankful to @GoldenAl for accepting and enduring a punishment that he had nothing to do with. He saw us through tough times."
